definitions.definition: used to refer to a particular person, thing or event that is close to you, especially compared with another

examples.text: How long have you been living in this country?
Well, make up your mind. Which do you want? This one or that one?
I think you'll find these more comfortable than those.
Is this your bag?

definitions.definition: used to refer to something/somebody that has already been mentioned

examples.text: There was a court case resulting from this incident.
The boy was afraid and the dog had sensed this.
What's this I hear about you getting married?
Hello, **this is** Carlos Diaz *(= on the phone)*.
Is this Maria? *(= on the phone)*
Is that Maria?
Jo, this is Kate *(= when you are introducing them)*.
This is the captain speaking.

definitions.definition: used for showing somebody to something or calling somebody's attention to something

examples.text: Do it like this *(= in the way I am showing you)*.
Listen to this.

definitions.definition: used with periods of time related to the present

examples.text: this week/month/year
I saw her this morning *(= today in the morning)*.
Do you want me to come this Tuesday *(= Tuesday of this week)* or next Tuesday?
Do it **this minute** *(= now)*.
He never comes to see me **these days** *(= now, as compared with the past)*.

definitions.definition: used to refer to somebody/something that is connected with a person, especially when you have a particular attitude towards it or them

examples.text: These new friends of hers are supposed to be very rich.

definitions.definition: used when you are telling a story or telling somebody about something

examples.text: There was this strange man sitting next to me on the plane.
I've been getting these pains in my chest.
‘What did you talk about?’ ‘Oh, this and that.’

wordOrigin: Old English, neuter of thes, of West Germanic origin; related to that and the.
